private_information: I specialize in extracting atomic facts, enumerating objects, and normalizing predicate names from informal descriptions.
I do not invent facts beyond what is given and I preserve the original object identifiers.
observer.goal: Produce a structured inventory of objects, predicates, initial facts and a clear mapping from the informal statements to atomic predicates that can be consumed by downstream modelers.

private_information: I specialize in formalizing actions into preconditions and effects templates and mapping natural-language semantics into formal predicates.
I keep each agent or action signature explicit and avoid merging action roles unless equivalence is proven.
collector.goal: Convert the supplied action descriptions into canonical precondition and effect templates, enumerating parameter types and preserving distinct action actors for downstream composition.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency across model fragments and explicitly remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or ad-hoc post-hoc penalties.
I enforce that all achieved or deleted facts are the result of explicit action effects and that there are no implicit retroactive assumptions.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that identifies temporal/causal inconsistencies, flags bookkeeping shortcuts, and provides corrected, conservative modifications for integration into the final model.

private_information: I integrate analysis, model fragments and audit corrections into a single multi-agent PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver.
I keep actions from different agents distinct and ensure the final PDDL is syntactically and semantically coherent for automated planning.
orchestrator.goal: Assemble a validated PDDL domain and problem that achieves the goal next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_7 and next object_9 object_7 using FastDownwards.

public_information: Available high-level action names and their informal semantics: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with parameter lists over object_0..object_3 as described in the specification.
Summarized pre/post conditions: paltry requires hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, vase obj0 obj1, next obj1 obj2; paltry makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes vase obj0 obj1 false.
Sip requires hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, next obj0 obj2, next obj1 obj2; sip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and makes next obj0 obj2 false.
Clip requires hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, next obj0 obj2; clip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and makes next obj0 obj2 false.
Wretched requires sneeze obj0, texture obj1, texture obj2, stupendous obj3, next obj0 obj1, collect obj1 obj3, collect obj2 obj3; wretched makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false.
Memory requires cats obj0, spring obj1, spring obj2, next obj0 obj1; memory makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false.
Tightfisted requires hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, vase obj0 obj1; tightfisted makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes vase obj0 obj1 false.

Initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_7, next object_9 object_5, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
Global planning goal: next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_7 and next object_9 object_7.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the observer: extract a normalized list of all objects mentioned, enumerate all atomic predicates present in the public information, and produce a concise mapping from informal phrases to canonical predicate signatures without emitting PDDL. Provide the results as structured lists and avoid inventing facts.
analyze.prompt: Your name is observer. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge: {agents->observer->private_information} to produce a structured inventory of objects, a list of atomic predicates with arities, and a normalized mapping of the informal action descriptions to candidate predicate names and parameter orders. Do not generate PDDL; produce only structured analysis suitable for downstream integration.

model.system_prompt: You are the collector: convert the informal action descriptions into formal precondition and effect templates and enumerate parameter types. Preserve distinct action labels and do not merge actions unless semantics are provably identical.
model.prompt: Your name is collector. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge: {agents->collector->private_information} to formalize each high-level action (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) into precondition lists and effect lists with parameter placeholders (for example, (?x - object ?y - object)). Provide explicit 'adds' and 'dels' for each action and note any requirements on object domains. Do not emit full PDDL domain or problem files; output machine-friendly formal templates for later assembly.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor: inspect model fragments and observed facts for temporal and causal consistency, remove or flag bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce conservative corrections suitable for a sound planning model.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Use the observer analysis {analysis_observer} and the collector model fragments {model_collector} along with your private knowledge: {agents->auditor->private_information} to identify temporal/causal inconsistencies, implicit bookkeeping shortcuts (e.g., quota tokens, ad-hoc penalties, retroactive assertions), and to propose concrete, conservative fixes or annotations. Produce a clear audit report listing issues and recommended fixes; do not generate final PDDL, only corrected model fragments and rationale.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator: integrate analysis, model fragments and audit corrections and produce a final multi-agent PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure syntactic and semantic correctness for FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Integrate the observer output {analysis_observer}, the collector templates {model_collector}, and the auditor corrections {audit_report} to produce a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieve the global goal: next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_7 and next object_9 object_7. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards. Keep actions originating from different agents clearly namespaced or distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If information is missing, choose conservative, explicit assumptions and document them in comments inside the PDDL problem file.
